input:

17:20 Caption: Lucas Andersen (Ajax) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!

17:47 Caption: Ricardo van Rhijn (Ajax) commits a rough foul. Pedro Proenca stops the game and makes a call.
17:51 Event: Foul by Ajax
18:02 Event: Indirect free-kick by Barcelona
19:10 Caption: Barcelona are happy showing off their ball keeping skills and that is only interrupted when the defender steps in.
19:58 Caption: Jordi Alba (Barcelona) crosses the ball forward but it is intercepted. The linesman signals a throw-in for Barcelona.
20:02 Event: Ball out of play
20:08 Event: Throw-in by Barcelona

21:31 Event: Indirect free-kick by Ajax
22:39 Event: Shots off target by Ajax
22:40 Event: Ball out of play
22:44 Caption: Lasse Schone (Ajax) has a go from distance but he can't find the target as it goes well wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Barcelona.
22:56 Event: Clearance by Barcelona
23:04 Event: Ball out of play
23:12 Event: Clearance by Barcelona
25:02 Event: Shots off target by Ajax
25:03 Caption: Ricardo van Rhijn (Ajax) receives a good pass just outside the box, unleashes a strike from a promising position, but the shot is blocked by the defender.
25:23 Caption: Niklas Moisander (Ajax) dinks a cross into the box in an attempt to find one of his teammates, but the defence manages to clear.
25:30 Caption: Lucas Andersen (Ajax) strikes the ball towards goal, but it fails to reach the target after being well blocked by one of the defenders.
25:31 Event: Shots on target by Ajax
25:37 Event: Shots on target by Ajax
25:40 Caption: Marc-Andre ter Stegen pulls off a great save to deny Davy Klaassen (Ajax) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
26:08 Event: Ball out of play
26:20 Event: Throw-in by Ajax
26:42 Caption: Ricardo van Rhijn (Ajax) tries to send a low pass into the box, but it's blocked and cleared.
28:28 Event: Shots off target by Barcelona
28:31 Event: Ball out of play
28:35 Caption: 7:13 â€“ this is the total number of shots produced by both teams.
28:54 Caption: Luis Suarez (Barcelona) shoots from outside the box, but his effort is blocked. Barcelona force their opponents to concede a corner.
29:01 Event: Corner by Barcelona
29:07 Caption: Xavi (Barcelona) takes the corner with a short pass.
29:26 Caption: Dani Alves (Barcelona) swings in a cross, but the ball is cleared to safety by one of the defending players.
30:01 Caption: Jordi Alba (Barcelona) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Jasper Cillessen to get hold of the ball.

31:43 Caption: Jordi Alba (Barcelona) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Pedro Proenca no option but to blow his whistle.
32:46 Caption: A poorly executed mid-range free kick by Davy Klaassen (Ajax) as he fails to deliver a decent cross.
32:48 Event: Indirect free-kick by Ajax

34:36 Caption: The sound of the whistle has almost been drowned out in the deafening atmosphere of this match. Lionel Messi (Barcelona) is setting the ball up for a free kick from mid-range.
34:59 Event: Direct free-kick by Barcelona
34:59 Event: Shots on target by Barcelona
35:03 Caption: Lionel Messi (Barcelona) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top left corner only for Jasper Cillessen to dive and make a save.
35:16 Event: Shots on target by Barcelona
35:17 Event: Goal by Barcelona
35:40 Caption: It's in the back of the net! Marc Bartra puts the ball on a plate for Lionel Messi (Barcelona), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 0:1.

46:04 Caption: The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
46:59 Caption: The performance from both teams could be described as average. There have been only a few exciting situations and the fans will be expecting more in the second half. It has been a tight contest so far. Both sides are using combination football to try and gain the upper hand.

Second Half:

15:55 Caption: Xavi (Barcelona) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the middle of the target, but Jasper Cillessen was alert and the score remains the same.

25:27 Caption: An infringement by Joel Veltman (Ajax) results in a yellow card and as it's the second time today, he also sees a red and is dismissed by Pedro Proenca.

26:18 Event: Direct free-kick by Barcelona
26:18 Caption: Lionel Messi (Barcelona) strikes the ball harmlessly from a long-range free kick and it goes high over the bar. It's not easy to score from a distance like that. The ball goes out of play and Ajax will have a goal kick.
26:19 Event: Ball out of play
26:46 Event: Substitution by Ajax

31:03 Event: Kick-off by Ajax

44:41 Event: Corner by Barcelona

46:50 Caption: Lionel Messi (Barcelona) can bury his head in the sand! He misses the rebound from inside the penalty box as he plants a header high over the bar! A typical school boyâ€™s error!
47:10 Caption: That's all for today as the game is over.
47:59 Caption: It was an attractive offensive game and the fans have no reason to be upset. The away team was superior on the pitch today. Both sides tried to prevail using combination football.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a gripping encounter at the Amsterdam Arena, Barcelona secured a 2-0 victory over Ajax, further establishing their prowess in European football. The match kicked off with Barcelona quickly setting the tone, as they started from the center circle precisely at 00:00. Immediately, the action began to build with Barcelona comfortably holding possession. Yet, the game got its first pause at 01:26 when the ball went out of play.

Barcelona resumed with a throw-in at 01:33, only for play to be halted again as an offside was flagged against them at 03:27. Ajax received an indirect free-kick due to this infringement, and the early exchanges continued to be characterized by minor infringements and spells of broken play, as both teams fought to establish their rhythm.

The proceedings got a bit scrappy with several throw-ins taking place around the sixth minute. Ajax threw in twice more but without creating any significant chances. Indeed, the succession of throw-ins continued, signaling a lack of fluidity in the opening minutes of the encounter. By the seventh minute, Ajax had won a throw-in only to find themselves immediately disrupted by a foul from Barcelona. The referee, Pedro Proenca, didn't hesitate to issue the first yellow card of the match to a Barcelona player at 07:34. Ajax's indirect free-kick at 08:16 from the foul didn't amount to much as they soon conceded a foul themselves.

Ten minutes in, a notable incident occurred as Sergio Busquets seemed to recover from an earlier knock that had briefly appeared significant. The stop-start nature of the game persisted with another foul, this time by Ajax at 11:36, leading to a free-kick for Barcelona. Mascherano attempted to break the stalemate with a precise pass in the 12th minute, only for an opposition defender to intervene.

Around the 14th minute mark, Niklas Moisander of Ajax committed a harsh foul, which led to another indirect free-kick for Barcelona. The threw the ball in once more at 14:46. Barcelona struggled to make meaningful inroads as Ivan Rakitic's attempted pass was impressively blocked by an opposing defender. Ajax then launched their first real offensive effort with Davy Klaassen managing to miss the left post by inches on a rebound from Lucas Andersen's cross.

Continuing in this vein, Ajax, through Ricardo van Rhijn and Moisander, worked up promising positions only to be foiled by the Barcelona defense. The persistence paid off, and their forward driving play led to a double attempt on goal just before the 25th-minute mark. However, Marc-Andre ter Stegen's heroics in goal for Barcelona kept the scoreboard reading 0-0. His save, particularly denying Klaassen's effort which was heading for the bottom corner, stood out.

The Catalans attempted to wrest control back, with quick movement upfield leading to Luis Suarez having a shot blocked outside the box in the 28th minute. The resultant corner saw Xavi swing in from the right yet the threat was dealt with by the Ajax defense. The game opened up as Jordi Alba found himself in prime attacking territory but Jasper Cillessen, the Ajax shot-stopper, was alert enough to neutralize the danger.

Apart from the defensive solidity showcased, the next significant set-piece saw Lionel Messi poised over a free-kick. His shot toward the top left corner demanded quick reflexes from Cillessen, who was up to the task. However, Messi was not to be denied as soon after, in the 35th minute, he capitalized on a well-placed header by Marc Bartra to break the deadlock, putting Barcelona 1-0 up.

Ajax kicked off once more with a renewed sense of urgency only to be stopped again by a series of fouls that punctuated their rhythm. The game saw yet more interruptions, with Barcelona's Jordi Alba also shown a yellow card at 41:20 for a rash challenge. As the half drew to a close, the frenetic pace brought a yellow card for Dani Alves, illustrating the intensity of the contest.

The half-time whistle was a chance for reflection, with Barcelona, although leading, not entirely dominating the game. Ajax, though trailing, had their moments and would hope to capitalize on them in the second half.

The second half got underway with Ajax taking the initiative, though the initial exchanges remained punctuated by interruptions. However, Barcelona quickly began asserting their dominance yet again. Xavi's corner at 03:23 established this when he sent a beautiful cross that met stern Ajax defensive resistance.

Neymarâ€™s foul shortly after didnâ€™t diminish the charge from Barcelona as they kept pressing Ajax, forcing multiple saves from the Ajax goalkeeper, Jasper Cillessen. The defensive resilience of the home team was noteworthy, but Barcelonaâ€™s relentless attack displayed superior ball control and tactical astuteness.

Luis Suarez's agile footwork and ball control posed continuous threats to Ajaxâ€™s defenses. However, despite multiple attempts on goal, it wasn't until around the 15th minute of the second half that the tension escalated significantly. Ajaxâ€™s Joel Veltman received a second yellow card for a rough challenge and was subsequently sent off, leaving Ajax with ten men and further tilting the balance in Barcelonaâ€™s favour.

Barcelona capitalized on the numerical advantage almost immediately, and Messi, in particular, was seen maneuvering through the Ajax defense with agility and precision. Around the 26th minute, Messi attempted a long-range free kick, which went high over the bar.

With Ajax making strategic substitutions, like bringing on Arkadiusz Milik for Kolbeinn Sigthorsson and Jairo Riedewald for Lucas Andersen, they aimed to stabilize and perhaps counter Barcelonaâ€™s relentless surge. In response, Barcelona brought on Pedro for Neymar and Rafinha for Ivan Rakitic, injecting fresh energy to sustain their attacking momentum.

As Barcelona maintained pressure, Lionel Messi found the net again in the 30th minute following a sequence of well-coordinated passes and strategic positioning by Pedro. This second goal further solidified Barcelonaâ€™s dominance as they continued to control play with finesse and precision.

Ajax, with their spirits dampened, tried to claw back into the game, receiving support from substitutions like Stefano Denswil for Thulani Serero. Despite their efforts, their energy seemed to wane against the unyielding Catalan defense and sharp counter-offensives led by Messi, Suarez, and Xavi.

The match saw intermittent attempts from Ajax, but it was clear that Barcelonaâ€™s control of the game was comprehensive. Pedro had a promising opportunity around the 37th minute but his header from near the penalty spot flew wide of the right post.

Drawing toward the end, Barcelona continued to dominate possession and strategically shut down any resurgence attempts by Ajax. Adriano came on for Dani Alves, maintaining the fortitude of Barcelonaâ€™s defense and ensuring their clean sheet.

The final whistle at the 47th minute confirmed Barcelonaâ€™s authoritative performance, finishing the match with a 2-0 victory. The intricate passing, strategic playmaking, and Messiâ€™s clinical finishing played a pivotal role in securing this win. The crowd witnessed a masterclass of European football where Barcelonaâ€™s experienced lineup effectively nullified Ajaxâ€™s spirited efforts.

In conclusion, the game was a showcase of Barcelona's tactical superiority and technical brilliance. Despite Ajaxâ€™s valiant efforts, particularly during the first 30 minutes of the first half, they were unable to break through Barcelona's well-organized defense and clinical attack. This match will be remembered as a classic display of European football where precision, skill, and execution dictated the final outcome, leaving Barcelona with well-earned three points and an impressive away victory.
